caracteristics.name: Mastermind
caracteristics.ex: The main villain in a story

talents.desc: Passive; Upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.
Passive; Upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.
Passive; Upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Passive; Your character creates a bond with a single animal approved by your GM. This animal must be silhouette 0 (no larger than a mid-sized dog). The bond persists as long as your character chooses, although at your GM’s discretion, the bond may also be broken due to abusive treatment or other extenuating circumstances.  As long as the bond persists, the animal follows your character, and you dictate the animal’s overall behavior (although, since the animal is only bonded with the character, not dominated, it may still perform inconvenient actions such as scratching furniture, consuming rations, and marking territory). Once per round in structured encounters, your character may spend one maneuver to direct their animal in performing one action and one maneuver during your character’s turn. The animal must be within hearing and visual range of your character (generally medium range) to do this. Otherwise, the animal does not contribute to the encounter. The specifics of its behavior are up to you and your GM.  For every additional rank of Animal Companion your character has, increase the allowed silhouette of the companion by one (this may mean your character gets a new companion, or their companion grows in size).  This talent can also change in flavor depending on the nature of your game setting. While an animal companion may make sense in many settings, in a futuristic setting it may make more sense for the “animal” to be a robot or drone, for example.

Active (Incidental, Out of Turn); Your character can only use this talent while piloting a starfighter or airplane of Silhouette 3 or less. When your vehicle suffers a hit from a ranged combat check, after damage is calculated but before armor is applied, your character may have their vehicle suffer 3 system strain to use this talent. Then, reduce the damage suffered by a number equal to their ranks in Piloting.

Activation: Active (Maneuver); Once per encounter, your character may use this talent.  Until the end of the encounter or until they are incapacitated, your character adds 󲊳 󲊴 󲊴 to all melee combat checks they make. However, opponents add 󲊳 to all combat checks targeting your character. While berserk, your character cannot make ranged combat checks.  At the end of the encounter (or when they are incapacitated), your character suffers 6 strain.
page 95
Active (Incidental, Out of Turn); Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to add automatic 󲊱 󲊱 to another character’s social skill check

Active (Maneuver); Once per turn, your character may use this talent to have a number of allies engaged with your character equal to your ranks in Leadership add 󲊴 to all combat checks they make until the end of your character’s next turn. The range of this talent increases by one band per rank of Coordinated Assault beyond the first.

Active (Incidental); When making a Computers check to hack a system or break into a secured network, before rolling, your character may use this talent to add 󲊳 󲊳 󲊱 󲊱 to the results. Tier: 3 If you are using the optional hacking rules on page 232 and your check generates 󲊱 󲊱, your GM should spend it on the I Know You! option in Table I.2-22 on page 234.
Active (Maneuver); Your character may use this talent to decrease the difficulty of the next combined combat check (see Two-Weapon Combat, on page 108) they make during the same turn by one.
Passive; Your character adds 󲊸 to their melee combat checks while engaged with a single opponent. Your character adds 󲊸 to their melee combat checks while engaged with three or more opponents.
page 95
page 96
page 97

Active (Action); Your character may use this talent to make an Average (󲊷 󲊷) Leadership check. If successful, a number of allies equal to your character’s Presence may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform one maneuver (out of turn). If there are any questions as to which allies take their maneuvers first, your character is the final arbiter.
page 97

Active (Incidental); When your character makes a ranged combat check with a weapon that has the Blast item quality, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to trigger the weapon’s Blast quality, instead of spending 󲊴 (even if the attack misses). In addition, your character treats grenades as having a range of medium.

Active (Action); Once per round, your character may use this talent to perform a ranged combat check against one non-vehicle target within range of the weapon used. If the check is successful, halve the damage inflicted by the attack (before reducing damage by the target’s soak). The target is immobilized until the end of its next turn.

Passive; When your character uses the Field Commander talent, your character affects a number of allies equal to twice the character’s Presence.  In addition, you may spend 󲊵 to allow one ally to suffer 1 strain to perform an action, instead of a maneuver.

Active (Action); Your character may use this talent to make an Average (󲊷 󲊷) Leadership check. For each 󲊳 the check generates, one ally within short range heals one strain. For each 󲊴, one ally benefiting from Inspiring Rhetoric heals one additional strain. Allies affected by your character’s Inspiring Rhetoric add 󲊸 to all skill checks they make for a number of rounds equal to your character's rank in Leadership.

Active (Incidental, Out of Turn); When your character suffers a hit from a melee combat check and uses Parry to reduce the damage from that hit, after the attack is resolved, you may spend 󲊲 or 󲊱 󲊱 󲊱 from the attacker’s check to use this talent. Then, your character automatically hits the attacker once with a Brawl or Melee weapon your character is wielding. The hit deals the weapon’s base damage, plus any damage from applicable talents or abilities. Your character can’t use this talent if the original attack incapacitates them.

Active (Action); Your character may use this talent to make an Average (󲊷 󲊷) Coercion check. For each 󲊳 the check generates, one enemy within short range suffers 1 strain. For each 󲊴, one enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers 1 additional strain. Enemies affected by your character’s Scathing Tirade add 󲊸 to all skill checks they make for a number of rounds equal to your character’s ranks in Coercion.

Active (Incidental, Out of Turn); Once per encounter, when your character would be incapacitated due to exceeding their wound or strain threshold, you may spend a Story Point to use this talent. Then, your character is not incapacitated until the end of their next turn. If your character reduces their strain or wounds to below their threshold before the end of their next turn, they are not incapacitated.

Active (Incidental); When your character purchases this talent, choose one characteristic. After your character makes a successful combat check, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to add damage equal to your character’s ranks in that characteristic to one hit of the combat check.

Active (Incidental); When you purchase this talent for your character, choose one skill. Once per round, your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent to reduce the difficulty of the next check they make using that skill by two, to a minimum of Easy (󲊷).
page 97
Active (Incidental); When your character purchases this talent, choose two skills. Once per session, your character may use this talent to reroll one skill check that uses one of those two skills.

Active (Incidental, Out of Turn); When your character suffers a hit from a melee combat check, after damage is calculated but before soak is applied (so immediately after Step 3 of Perform a Combat check, page 102), your character may suffer 3 strain to use this talent to reduce the damage of the hit by two plus their ranks in Parry. This talent can only be used once per hit, and your character needs to be wielding a Melee weapon.

Active (Incidental); Once per round on your character’s turn, they may use this talent to draw or holster an easily accessible weapon or item as an incidental. Quick Draw also reduces a weapon’s Prepare rating by one, to a minimum of one.

Active (Action); Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to make an opposed Charm or Coercion versus Discipline check targeting one character within medium range (or within earshot). If successful, the target suffers strain equal to twice your character’s Presence, plus one additional strain per 󲊳. Your character heals strain equal to the strain inflicted.
Active (Incidental); Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to heal an amount of strain equal to their ranks in Second Wind.
page 97
Passive; When your character makes a Medicine check to heal wounds, the target heals one additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

abilities.desc: May make a Hard Leadership check; if successful, allies within medium range may perform a second maneuver during their turn without suffering strain; this character may spend ⮝ to increase the damage of affected allies' attacks by an amount equal to the ⮝ spent; both of these effects last until the end of this character's next turn.

After calling in a favor, this character may make an opposed Coercion versus Discipline check; if successful the target still owes this character a favor; 󲊵 means the target now owes a favor of one magnitude great than before.
As an incidental, at the start of its turn a minion group that is engaged with an enemy may remove a member of its group as a casualty to add +6 damage to the minion group’s attack in that turn.

Make an Average Verse check. If the check is successful, until the end of the character’s next turn, all other characters within medium range must first suffer one strain before using the concentrate maneuver. This character can sustain this effect with the concentrate maneuver.
The character may cast magic spells without incurring the strain (or wound, if Rival or Minion) a number of times per encounter equal to ranks in this ability.
After making a succesful Brawl combat check, may spend 󲊴󲊴 or 󲊵 to devour 1 Æmber the target possesses.
A character may make Hard Survival check to dig one Æmber out of a destroyed tree and may spend 󲊵 to extra two Æmber per 󲊵 spent this way.
When this character makes or assists a check that involves Æmber, they may spend 󲊴󲊴 to add 󲊳󲊱󲊱 to the results.
The character may make a Hard Survival check to open up a freshly slain Æmberdrake and remove two Æmber per 󲊳 and five per 󲊵 spent from the check this way.
Once per encounter, may spend a Story Point before making a skill check to double this character’s Brawn value and require 1 fewer 󲊴 to activate any item quality for that check.
A character may make a Hard Survival check to extract one Æmber per 󲊳 and two Æmber per 󲊵 spent from a freshly defeated snufflegator’s spines.
May spend ⛯ when making a check to determine Initiative to steal one randomly determined item of encumbrance 2 or less from the character who generated the least ✸ on their check.
The character adds 󲊴 to combined checks they make to attack with two melee weapons.
Can fly; see page 100 of the Genesys Core Rulebook.
May remove 󲊱󲊱 from operating checks made to control an airship or other flying vehicle.
If this character has access to a server, increase the strength of all sentry ice on that server by 2.
When attacking a target that has not yet acted during the current encounter, this creature adds 󲊸󲊸 to its combat checks.
As an incidental, this character may increase or decrease its silhouette by 1.
This creature may breathe underwater and never suffers movement penalties for traveling through water.
While within short range of another adversary of this kind, this character adds 󲊳 to their combat checks and 󲊵 if the opponent is a dragon.

May spend 󲊱󲊱󲊱 or 󲊲 from checks made by enemy characters in the current encounter to hide or blend into the crowd; enemies must make a successful opposed Perception or Vigilance versus Stealth check to locate this character until they make a combat check or otherwise reveal themselves.
When making a Brawl or Melee combat check targeting a prone opponent, add 󲊳󲊴󲊴 to the results.

󲊲 may be spent on a failed check this character makes during a turn in which they direct their animal companion to have the companion make a combat check as an out-of-turn incidental targeting this character; 󲊵 may be spent on this combat check to also have the animal run away.
Adds 󲊸 to Coercion checks.

At the start of their first turn in the encounter, all opponents must make a Hard Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If they fail, they are immobilized until the start of their next turn instead. If you’re using the fear rules (see GCRB page 243), this counts as a fear check, and other effects may apply as well.
Once per encounter when making a combat check, may use Discipline and Willpower instead of the normal skill and characteristic.
Suffers no penalties for moving through water and can breathe underwater, but cannot move or survive on land.
This character treats foliage as clear terrain.
Silver, blessed, or holy weapons and ammunition count their Crit rating as 1 when used against this character.
When this character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Melee combat check, spend a Story Point to inflict the Bleeding Out Critical Injury in-stead of rolling a result.
When another character fails a check targeting this character, that character suffers 2 strain.
When providing assistance, this character adds 󲊳󲊴 to the results instead of a 󲊸.
Whenever an ally within short range makes a successful combat check, other allies in the encounter recover 2 strain.
Once this character or minion group has taken damage, reduce the Critical rating of its attacks to 1.

May spend 󲊱󲊱 from an opponent’s check to give the opponent the Fear (this character) Motivation until the end of the session in addition to their other motivations. This character always knows when other characters have the Fear (this character) Motivation.
This character does not need to breathe, eat, or drink; they can survive in vacuum and underwater; is immune to poisons and toxins; and cannot knowingly endanger humans.

When a feral lycanthrope in their animal form makes an unarmed attack and inflicts a Critical Injury result of 51 or higher on a human PC or human nemesis NPC [your GM has final say on what counts as human], the character gains the Bite of the Wolf and Call of the Moon abilities [if the target is a PC, use the abilities listed in the cursed shifter archetype found on page 20 instead]).
In wilderness areas, this character gains defense 1.
When this character damages a target using fangs or a magic attack, they heal wounds equal to the wounds inflicted.
While at least on opponent in an encounter is suffering a Critical Injury, this character increases the base damage of its attacks by 2.

If this character suffers damage in excess of their Wound Threshold, they are not incapacitated, but takes the form of a cloud of blood mist. While in this form, this character can fly (see page 100 of the Genesys Core Rulebook) and does not suffer damage from physical attacks. If they suffer additional damage from a magical attack, they become incapacitated as normal and resume corporeal form.
When this character inflicts wounds with its fangs, it heals an equal number of wounds.
When this character is targeted by a melee combat check, they may spend 󲊱󲊱󲊱 or 󲊲 to cause the attack to suffer 3 wounds.

Once per encounter, may suffer 3 strain and spend a maneuver to force all other character within long range (or within earshot) to make a Daunting Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If they fail, they must use their maneuver to move farther away; if they fail with ⯐, they must also downgrade their action to an additional maneuver to move even farther away. If you're using the fear rules found on page 243 of the Genesys Core Rulebook, this can be a fear check instead.
May suffer 1 strain to add 󲊳 to any Intellect-based check.
When this character inflicts a Critical Injury or Critical Hit, roll twice and choose the more severe result.
When this character directs its mount, the mount may perform an action and a maneuver and is not limited to using its maneuvers to move only.
This character adds 󲊴󲊴 to the results of checks they make targeting authority figures.

Once per round after a character moves within medium range of this character, this character may perform an out-of-turn incidental to immobilize that character for the remainder of the encounter. The immobilized character can attempt a Hard Athletics check each turn to break from the immobilization.
When encountering ice, reduce that ice’s strength by 2 and increase the 󲊱 required to activate negative effects by 1.
This character may use their Intellect when opposing Deception, Skulduggery, and Stealth checks that target them.

When the full moon rises, this character transforms into a monstrous wolf or giant hunting cat as an out-of-turn incidental; they heal all strain they are currently suffering, increase their Brawn and Agility by one to a maximum of 5, and reduce their Intellect and Willpower by one to a minimum of 1; all opponents must halve the damage dealt to this character while transformed before applying soak, unless their weapon is made of silver or uses silver ammunition; the transformation lasts until the following dawn or until this character is incapacitated due to exceeding their wound threshold.
This character may remove 󲊸 from Cool, Discipline, and Vigilance checks.
This character adds 󲊸󲊸 to Stealth checks in [GM-specified] surroundings.

While this character is present in an encounter, the GM may spend 󲊲 from any check to force all other characters to make a Hard Vigilance or Coordination check as an out-of-turn incidental; anyone who fails suffers 4 wounds and 4 strain.
This character may make a maneuver to move normally up and down vertical surfaces, across ropes, and over otherwise impassable structures.
Once per turn, this character may spend a Story Point to move to any location within short range as an incidental, including locations that are vertically distant or have no easy access route.

During a Network encounter, may spend an action to make a Hard Knowledge (The Net) check; if successful, opponents must upgrade the difficulty of checks made on the system for the rest of the encounter twice, and allies must upgrade the difficulty of checks made on the system for the rest of the encounter once.

abilities.ability: Certain You Want To Do This?
abilities.desc: When targeting this character with a check, a character suffers 1 strain.
Once per session, this character may spend a Story Point to count as having 3 ranks in any skill they do not posses until the end of the encounter.
Allies within short range add 󲊳 to checks they make; opponents within short range add 󲊱 to checks they make.
For every round that passes in an encounter featuring this character, an hour passes outside of the encounter.
May spend 󲊴 from a Brawl combat check to hit an additional engaged opponent that would be no more difficult to attack than the original target, dealing base damage +1 per 󲊳.
If this character suffers a Critical Injury, add +20 to the result.
While within short range of another minion group of the same type, both groups gain 1 melee defense.

Once per encounter when this character incapacitates a target, they may force all allies of the target to make an Average Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If they fail, they lose their free maneuver during their next turn; if you’re using the fear rules (page 243, CRB), this counts as a fear check and other effects may apply as well.
Reduce any critical injury result suffered by 30, to a minimum of 1.
This character does not need to breathe, eat, or drink; can survive in vacuum and underwater, and is immune to poisons and toxins.
This character may use Knowledge (Society) instead of Charm, Coercion, or Negotiation during social interactions with undercity residents.
Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink, and can survive in vacuum and underwater; immune to poisons and toxins.

This character may spend a maneuver to make an opposed Coordination versus Coordination check targeting one engaged opponent to immobilize that opponent until the end of their next turn. At the start of their next turn, the opponent suffers 3 wounds, and the swarm heals 3 wounds.
During any encounter this character or their allies may spend a Story Point when an opponent would learn their location or identity instead.
When performing the assist maneuver, this character adds 󲊳󲊱󲊱 to the result instead of adding 󲊸.

This character may spend 󲊱󲊱󲊱 or 󲊲 from any Melee or Brawl check targeting them to corrupt 1 Æmber the opponent carries (this essentially destroys the Æmber, with other effects as determined by the GM).
This character reduces the difficulty of Arcana checks by one, to a minimum of Easy, and increases the base damage of their Attack spells by 3.
This characters adds 󲊴 to combat checks if there are two or more members in the minion group.
When a character within short range makes a check that generates 󲊲, this character heals 1 strain.
While engaged with a vehicle, this character may make a Hard Athletics check as an action; if the check is successful, the vehicle suffers a Critical Hit and may not move during the following round.
May spend 󲊵 from a successful Brawl check to increase the base damage of its jaw attack to 14.

Cursed to Wander (Once they reach their wound threshold, a ghost must rest before manifesting in the world. If the attack that exceeded their wound threshold generated no 󲊴 or 󲊵, the ghost returns within moments. If the attack generated 󲊴 it can return sometime in the same scene, 󲊴󲊴 can return in the next scene, or 󲊵 can return the following day)
After making a combat check, may spend 󲊵 to have the target suffer a hit dealing damage equal to the base damage of one powered weapon the target possesses of this character’s choice.
This character may see in infrared and may remove up to 󲊸󲊸 added to this character’s check due to darkness.
This character may spend 󲊴󲊴󲊴 or 󲊵 from a social skill check they make targeting a PC to move one Story Point from the player pool to the GM pool.
This character can see in the absence of light without penalty.
When making skill checks, this character removes up to 󲊸󲊸 imposed due to darkness.
May spend 󲊱󲊱󲊱 or 󲊲 from any character’s check to have this character learn their present location.
This character upgrades the ability of Discipline checks they make to resist fear or intimidation once.
This character decreases the difficulty of combat checks it makes that target a character immobilized or staggered by its Irresistible Song by one.

When this character makes a successful Brawl combat check against an immobilized target, it may inflict a Critical Injury without spending ⮝ or ⛯; it may still spend ⮝⮝⮝ or ⛯ to add +10 to the results.
A demon is immune to poison and disease. A demon doubles its soak vs. non-magical attacks.

When engaged with a silhouette 2 or smaller terrain feature that is providing cover or obstructs movement—such as a section of fence, foxhole, door, or sandbagged emplacement—this character may spend an action and make a Hard Mechanics check; if successful, the terrain feature is destroyed and no longer provides or obstructs movement.
When jacking in from within the same building as the target server, this character automatically succeeds when making any check to access the system.

Once per encounter, as an action, may force all non-allied characters within medium range to make an Average Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental; those who fail must spend their next turn moving away from this character or minion group and attempting to leave the encounter if possible.

May use the Dominate action once per encounter, making an opposed Charm vs. Discipline check targeting one character in short range; if successful, the target is immobilized for 1 round per uncanceled 󲊳, and this character may spend 󲊵 to stagger the target until the end of their next turn.
This character reduces the damage they take from fire and similar sources by 3.
May use a maneuver to move a target affected by its thorny vines’ Ensnare quality to engaged range.
This character may spend a maneuver to pull an immobilized foe within short range to engaged range.
As an out-of-turn incidental, at the start of their turn, characters engaged with this character must make a Hard Resilience check or suffer 3 strain.
Once per session, this character can spend a Story Point to either re-roll the dice pool after making a check, or to force a PC to re-roll the dice pool after they make a check.
When targeted by a Coercion or Leadership check, this character may oppose this check with Deception and Cunning (instead of Discipline and Willpower).
This character adds 󲊸 to its checks to determine Initiative.
When a character within short range of this character removes strain at the end of an encounter, that character and this character both remove 2 additional strain.
Whenever allies at short range would suffer strain involuntarily, they suffer 2 less strain, to a minimum of 0.

As an action, may make an opposed survival versus Discipline check targeting one character at short range; if successful, this character may perform one additional maneuver during its turns for the remainder of the encounter without suffering strain (it still may only perform two maneuvers during its turn); the target loses its free maneuver during its turn for the remainder of the encounter.
When assisting or making a combined Knowledge check, add 󲊸 to the check.
Cannot be knocked prone or immobilized.
The first effect this character adds to a spell does not increase the difficulty of the Arcana check.

Each of these characters takes on different traits depending on its animating rune. Select one rune for each individual. Fire: add 󲊳󲊳 to checks the this character makes to determine initiative. Ice: upgrade the difficulty of social skill checks targeting this character once. Lightning: this character may perform a second maneuver without suffering strain. Stone: this character’s soak increases to 8. Other runes can be used at the GM’s discretion.
Add X to this creature’s encumbrance threshold.

This character chooses one target within short range and makes an Average Primal check; upon success, the target is immobilized, suffers 1 strain and 1 wound at the start of their turn, and adds ■■ to all checks they make; on their turn, the target may make a Daunting Discipline or Resilience check to end these effects; can sustain the effects of this spell by performing the concentrate maneuver.
Using the Auto-fire quality does not increase the difficulty of combat checks; each time this character triggers an additional hit, they suffer 1 strain.
May suffer 1 strain before making a Resilience check to heal a Critical Injury to add 󲊳 to the result, and increases the number of wounds healed by natural rest by 1.
This character may suffer 1 strain to add 󲊳 to Athletics or Brawl checks.
This character may control two rival drones or minion groups of up to 5 drone minions; may spend a maneuver to direct all controlled drones to perform an action and maneuver during their turn.

Before using this character, choose one of the following abilities: Arthropod: Has a thick exoskeleton and adds +2 to its soak value, Aquatic: Never treats water as difficult terrain and can breathe underwater, Arboreal: Treats vertical surfaces and forested areas as normal terrain, or Avian: May fly, as per page 100 of the Genesys Core Rulebook.
While this character is present in an encounter, add 󲊸󲊸 to checks friendly characters make to search an area.
Allies within short range add 󲊷 to Knowledge (Æmber) checks they make.
While exploring (or telling stories of their explorations), whenever this character recovers strain, they remove 3 additional strain and friendly characters within short range suffer 1 strain.
This character may spend an action to make a Hard Computer (Hacking) check; if successful, this character and allies learn the identity of one piece of ice on a server per 󲊳.
Before making an Athletics, Brawl, Melee, or Resilience check, may suffer 1 strain to add 󲊳󲊳 to the results.

This character chooses one target within medium range and makes an Average Divine check; if the check is successful, until the end of this character's next turn, after the target makes a check, this character may choose one type of die in the pool and reroll all of the dice of that type; can sustain the effects of this spell by performing a concentrate maneuver.
This character does not add 󲊸 to checks due to darkness or concealment, and is immune to abilities or Critical Injuries that affect a character’s sight.
When making a social skill check to inflict strain, this character inflicts 2 strain per 󲊳 unless the target knows this character’s Fear or Flaw motivations.

Once per encounter, may spend a Story Point to force one opponent within earshot to make a Hard Discipline check as an out-of-turn incidental. If they fail, they must fulfill one of this character’s requests, such as letting them past a checkpoint, stop attacking them, etc.
This character adds 󲊳󲊱 to any combat checks they make.
At the end of this character’s turn, if at short range of one or more non-demon characters suffering Critical Injuries, may heal a number of wounds equal to the total number of Critical Injuries.
When targeted by a melee combat check, may spend 󲊱󲊱 or 󲊲 from the results to cause the attack to suffer 4 strain.
When targeted by a melee combat check, may spend 󲊱󲊱 or 󲊲 from the results to cause the attacker to suffer 3 strain.
damage caused by fire ignores the troll's soak. Coercion checks made against a troll that are aided by fire gain 󲊸󲊸
This character does not suffer damage from natural heat or flame, and doubles its soak for purposes of reducing damage from magical fire.
If this character knows an opponent’s Strength motivation, when this character inflicts strain on the opponent, the opponent suffers 3 additional strain.
After making a combat check targeting a character in cover, may spend 󲊴󲊴 or 󲊵 to force the character to immediately move out of cover as an out-of-turn incidental.
This character can fly. See the Flying sidebar on page 100 of the Genesys Core Rulebook.
When making a combat check, add 󲊴 to the results for every other character in the minion group.

When making a combat skill check, this character may spend 󲊴 to let an ally of the same organization immediately perform a maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental; this character may instead spend  󲊴󲊴󲊴 or 󲊵 to let up to three crew members in the current encounter perform an immediate action as an out-of-turn incidental.
Once per round when targeted by a combat check, may choose one ally within short range; the attack then targets that character instead of this character.
When a non-demon within short range suffers a Critical Injury, may spend a Story Point to replace the result with an Agonizing Wound.
Characters within short range of this character add 󲊸 to their combat checks provided those characters are acting to uphold the law.
When in a forest, this character may spend 󲊴󲊴 from an Initiative check to make an immediate maneuver as an incidental.
This character may make a combined combat check with its weapons and fists without increasing the difficulty.
Add 󲊻󲊻 to social skill checks targeting this character.
After making a successful combat check, may spend 󲊳󲊳; after doing so, this character suffers 3 strain for each additional opponent hit.
Once per encounter as an action, may select a target within short range and one ally within medium range; the ally can make one immediate combat check against the target as an out-of-turn incidental.
A character must suffer 2 strain in order to make a combat check targeting this character.
When making a Coercion check to inflict strain during a social encounter, this character inflicts 2 additional strain.
Reduce any damage from hits targeting this character by 3 unless the Burn item quality has been activated as a part of the attack.

May move over or through terrain (including doors and walls) without penalty. Halve the damage dealt to this character before applying soak, unless the attack came from a magical source such as a spell or magical weapon.
This character ignores the effects of terrain and darkness.
Brawl attacks that this character makes have a Critical rating of 3, and if they inflict critical injuries +40 is added to the resulting Critical Injury roll.
This character can fly, but cannot increase their altitude while doing so; see page 100 of the Genesys Core Rulebook.
Opponents must make a Hard Discipline check as an action and succeed before being able to make combat checks targeting this character.

Vanish (a hag coven can vanish, transported to another place of their choosing along with all of their possessions.)

Enemies who are wounded by this character must make a Hard Resilience check as an out-of-turn incidental or suffer 4 additional wounds, and must check again on their next turn if the check generates 󲊲.
When this character makes a check to determine Initiative order, 󲊴 on the check counts as 󲊳.
When performing the burn system action, reduce difficulty of check by 2, and damage the system one additional step for every additional 󲊳 (instead of 󲊳󲊳).
When this character suffers a Critical Injury from a weapon made of wood, such as a stake or crossbow bolt, they add +40 to the Critical Injury result.
Hits from fire or a weapon with the Burn item quality ignore this character’s soak.
This character adds 󲊸󲊸 to Perception and Vigilance checks to detect the use or effects of Magic skills.
When an opponent targets this character with a combat check, they suffer 4 strain.
Characters targeting this character with a social skill check suffer 3 strain.
While within medium range of this character, allies may perform a second maneuver without suffering strain.
Allies within short range add 󲊸 to their Deception checks and 󲊸 to their Discipline checks.
While in a forested area, this character upgrades the ability of Cool and Stealth checks they make twice.

Once per session may spend an action to make a Hard Computer (Sysops) check; if successful all ice or icebreakers controlled by this character or one ally increase their strength by 2 for the remainder of the encounter.
Increase the damage of a [weapon] by +1 for each additional minion in this minion group, to a maximum of +7.

May spend 󲊴󲊴󲊴 or 󲊵 from a success combat check using their liquid-metal lasso to inflict one hit from the weapon on one other target within short range of the original target, inflicting base damage +1 per 󲊳.
When making a Coercion check to maintain a favor after calling it in, the check is an Average Coercion check instead of an opposed check.

equipment.name: Small Beast or Creature
equipment.desc: Creatures and wild animals attack with their claws, teeth, tusks, or hooves. We treat these attacks as equipment, and have provided a few options here. These profiles represent creatures that are human-sized or smaller.
equipment.weapons: Teeth and claws (Brawl; Damage +2; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Vicious 1) or hooves and tusks (Brawl; Damage +2; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Knockdown, Stun 2).
equipment.equipment: None.

equipment.name: Large Beast or Creature
equipment.desc: Large creatures, as with small ones, treat their attacks as equipment. These profiles represent creatures much larger than a human, such as an elephant or large dinosaur.
equipment.weapons: Gaping maw or razor claws (Brawl; Damage +4; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Vicious 3), tentacles or thundering hooves (Brawl; Damage +5; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Knockdown, Concussive 1).
equipment.equipment: None.

equipment.name: Manual Laborer
equipment.desc: Manual laborers may be farmers, peasants, or others with access to pitchforks, shovels, sledgehammers, or other tools they can use as improvised weapons.
equipment.weapons: Large farming implement (Melee [Heavy]; Damage +3; Critical 5; Range [Engaged]; Cumbersome 3, Inferior).
equipment.equipment: Heavy clothes (+1 soak).

equipment.name: Basic Citizen
equipment.desc: In every setting, there are multitudes of average people simply living out their lives. This equipment package is for any character who has no reason to have weapons, armor, or specialized gear.
equipment.weapons: Fists (Brawl; Damage +0; Critical 6; Range [Engaged]; Disorient 1, Knockdown).
equipment.equipment: Clothing appropriate to the specific era, average coin purse or wallet.

equipment.name: Blue-Collar Worker
equipment.desc: Those who build, repair, work outdoors, and work with their hands have access to various tools or scrap that can be used as a weapon in a pinch.
equipment.weapons: Improvised brawling weapon (Brawl; Damage +1; Critical 5; Range [Engaged]; Disorient 2, Inferior).
equipment.equipment: Heavy clothing (+1 soak), tool belt full of tools (add 󲊳to checks this character makes to repair of fix something), wallet.

equipment.name: Traveler
equipment.desc: Travelers may be traders, shepherds, or wanderers who spend their time walking and sleeping outdoors.
equipment.weapons: Walking staff (Melee [Heavy]; Damage +2; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1, Disorient 2).
equipment.equipment: Heavy cloak (1 defense), survival pack (removes 󲊸 from Survival or Perception checks this character makes), meager coin purse or wallet.

equipment.name: Criminal
equipment.desc: Muggers, bandits, and thieves are all possible criminals.
equipment.weapons: Concealable melee weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +1; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2).
equipment.equipment: Dark clothing (2 defense, adds 󲊸 to Stealth checks this character makes), thieves’ tools (add 󲊴 to Skulduggery checks this character makes to open locks), backpack, rope with grappling hook.

equipment.name: Doctor
equipment.desc: This equipment array can be used for any sort of doctor or medical professional, from ancient barber-surgeons to modern general practitioners.
equipment.weapons: Sharp medical tool (Melee [Light]; Damage +0; Critical 1; Range [Engaged]).
equipment.equipment: Clean clothing and face protection (add 󲊸 to Resilience checks made by this character to resist disease or airborne toxins), medicine kit (allows this character to perform Medicine checks to heal wounds and critical injuries without penalty; after this character makes a successful Medicine check to heal wounds, heal one additional wound), notebook.

equipment.name: Noble
equipment.desc: Well-dressed, well-to-do members of society, nobles are typical of the aristocracy.
equipment.weapons: Dueling weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +2; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1).
equipment.equipment: Fancy clothing (adds 󲊴 to any social skill checks this character makes), signet of authority (adds 󲊳 to any social checks this character makes when interacting with someone of a lesser social standing), important documents, full coin purse or wallet.

equipment.name: Basic Ranged Warrior
equipment.desc: The ranged warrior array is ideal for medieval archers, modern infantry, and futuristic soldiers. It can also be used to equip characters who work in the wilderness.
equipment.weapons: Two-handed ranged weapon (Ranged; Damage 8; Critical 3; Range [Long]), one-handed backup weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +2; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Vicious 1).
equipment.equipment: Reinforced uniform or light armor (+1 soak), ammunition reload (may spend a maneuver to reload their ranged weapon after it runs out of ammo), survival pack (removes 󲊸 from Survival or Perception checks this character makes), 1 painkiller.

equipment.name: Heavy Ranged Warrior
equipment.desc: This equipment array represents warriors who use very powerful ranged weapons to support their fellows.  These might be scorpions or ballista in ancient times, modern machine guns, or futuristic rocket weapons.
equipment.weapons: Heavy rapid-firing ranged weapon (Gunnery; Damage 12; Critical 3; Range [Long]; Auto-Fire, Cumbersome 3, Vicious 2) or powerful single-shot ranged weapon (Gunnery; Damage 20; Critical 2; Range [Extreme]; Blast 10, Breach 2, Cumbersome 4, Limited Ammo 1, Prepare 1).
equipment.equipment: Heavy defensive armor (+3 soak), ammunition reload (may spend a maneuver to reload their ranged weapon after it runs out of ammo), backpack.

equipment.name: Basic Melee Warrior
equipment.desc: The basic melee warrior array can be used to equip the rank-and-file of ancient armies, modern riot cops, or even futuristic soldiers with powerful defenses.
equipment.weapons: One-handed defensive melee weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +2; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1), shield (Melee [Light]; Damage +0; Critical 6; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1, Deflection 1, Inaccurate 1, Knockdown).
equipment.equipment: Medium armor (+2 soak), satchel.

equipment.name: Heavy Melee Warrior
equipment.desc: This equips a character who relies on their armor to get close enough to bring heavy melee weapons to bear.  This could be used by a brave knight, a noble samurai, or a power-armored soldier with a plasma axe.
equipment.weapons: Two-handed powerful melee weapon (Melee [Heavy]; Damage +4; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Cumbersome 3, Pierce 2, Vicious 1) or one-handed versatile melee weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +3; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1) and shield (Melee [Light]; Damage +0; Critical 6; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1, Deflection 1, Inaccurate 1, Knockdown).
equipment.equipment: Heavy armor (1 defense, +2 soak).

equipment.name: Versatile Warrior
equipment.desc: This equipment array works for characters who use a combination of melee and ranged weapons. This could represent a cavalry soldier who fights with saber and pistol, an officer with a sword and sidearm, or a noble in a militant culture.
equipment.weapons: One-handed versatile melee weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +3; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1), one-handed ranged weapon (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 3; Range [Medium])
equipment.equipment: Reinforced clothing (1 defense, +1 soak).

equipment.name: Adventurer
equipment.desc: Adventurers journey into danger with a smile on their face and a torch in their hand. This could represent an explorer, an airship crewmember, or even a pirate.
equipment.weapons: One-handed ranged weapon (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Accurate 1), backup brawling weapon (Brawl; Damage +1; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Disorient 3).
equipment.equipment: Leather vest (+1 soak), backpack, length of rope, torch or other light source, and well-worn hat.

equipment.name: Bounty Hunter
equipment.desc: In nearly every setting there is a need for people who hunt down criminals, escaped prisoners, or other fugitives. Their equipment helps them in their task.
equipment.weapons: Short-ranged entangling weapon (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 4; Critical 5; Range [Short]; Disorient 3, Ensnare 3, Limited Ammo 1), stunning melee weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +3; Critical 5; Range [Engaged]; Stun 4; Stun Damage).
equipment.equipment: Medium armor (+2 soak), warrants for bounties, restraints.

equipment.name: Game Hunter
equipment.desc: Some individuals hunt from elevated tree-stands or blinds, waiting for prey to happen into range. This array could also be used for a sharpshooter or assassin.
equipment.weapons: Long-ranged hunting weapon (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 9; Critical 3; Range [Extreme]; Accurate 1, Limited Ammo 2; reduce the difficulty of combat checks made at long or extreme range by 1).
equipment.equipment: Camouflage (2 defense, add 󲊸 to Stealth checks made by this character), survival pack (removes 󲊸 from Survival or Perception checks this character makes), ammunition reload (may spend a maneuver to reload their ranged weapon after it runs out of ammo).

equipment.name: Law Enforcement Officer
equipment.desc: Law enforcement officials from modern cops to ancient town guards typically have some sort of protective clothing and then a ranged or melee weapon of some sort.
equipment.weapons: One-handed ranged weapon (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 3; Range [Medium]) or one-handed bludgeoning weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +3; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Disorient 2)
equipment.equipment: Light armor (+1 soak), badge of authority (adds 󲊸 to Coercion or Leadership checks this character makes), restraints, torch or other light source.

equipment.name: Pilot
equipment.desc: Combat pilots or operators of air vehicles must always be ready to land in hostile territory. In the appropriate setting, the flight outfit can be sealed against vacuum.
equipment.weapons: Concealable ranged weapon (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 4; Range [Short]).
equipment.equipment: Flight outfit, emergency survival kit (removes 󲊸 from Survival or Perception checks this character makes), 1 painkiller.

equipment.name: Flashy Outlaw
equipment.desc: This array can equip a criminal with a flair for large, dramatic, and potentially impractical weapons. This person probably gives off a certain roguish charm.
equipment.weapons: Intimidating ranged weapon (Ranged [Light]; Damage 7; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Inaccurate 1).
equipment.equipment: Dashing coat with exposed holster (+1 soak, adds 󲊴 to the results of all Charm and Coercion checks this character makes), fancy cape or hat (removes 󲊸 from all social skill checks this character makes).

equipment.name: Defensive Magic User
equipment.desc: This equipment array is only useful for characters who have at least one magic skill, and represents characters who use their magic defensively. This works with characters who use any magic skill.
equipment.weapons: None.
equipment.equipment: Magically enhanced robes (3 defense) augmenting magical implement (when the this character casts a spell, may add the Additional Target and Additional Summon effects without increasing the difficulty.  In addition, attack spells cast by this character increase their base damage by two), supernatural healing item (once per session, when this character heals wounds with a healing spell, increase the wounds healed by three).

equipment.name: Offensive Magic User
equipment.desc: This equipment array is only useful for characters who have at least one magic skill, and represents characters who use their magic to attack. This works with characters who use any magic skill.
equipment.weapons: One-handed melee weapon (Melee [Light]; Damage +3; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Defensive 1).
equipment.equipment: Robes (1 defense), offensive magical implement (when the this character casts a spell, the first Range effect they add doesn't increase the difficulty. In addition, attack spells cast by this character increase their base damage by four).

defense.name: Armored Hide
defense.ex: Rival or nemesis animals or non-humans

defense.name: Camouflaged
defense.ex: Rival or nemesis animals or non-humans

defense.name: Very Tough
defense.ex: Rival animals or non-humans and all nemeses

defense.name: Giant Body
defense.ex: Silhouette 3 or higher animal rivals and nemeses
